intro: Calluna vulgaris f. rigida, commonly known as the rigid heather, is a compact, low-growing shrub native to western Europe. It features dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and remain throughout the year, giving it a evergreen appearance. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and moorlands. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
